FILE: cm800811v11.0.txt
DYAD: THAILAND-CAMBODIA/KAMPUCHEA
RIVALRY: RIV1349
DISPUTE(S): MID1225 MID1226 MID1227 MID1228 MID2623 MID1229 MID2624 MID1216 MID1230 MID1610 MID2938 MID1605 MID1231 MID1232 MID4001 MID4135 MID4569 MID4588

RIVNOTES: 

PS: 19531109-19980502 0.00 19980503-20030410 -9 20030411-20151216 0.25 20151217-20209999 0.5

PS-UPDATE2020: Clear shift away from lesser rivalry to negative peace commencing on December 17, 2015, when Cambodia’s PM made the first visit to Thailand in 14 years, signaling a “new chapter” in relations (https://www.khmertimeskh.com/33782/hun-sen-visits-thailand/) •	“Nattawut Pothisaro, Thai ambassador to Cambodia, said the two countries have agreed to put controversial issues aside in a bid to restore ties and "focus on positive issues" ((https://www.bangkokpost.com/thailand/general/1094949/ties-with-cambodia-enter-new-chapter)) this is followed by subsequence cooperation in several areas. •	2018: both countries agree to step up defense cooperation: https://thediplomat.com/2018/06/a-new-thailand-cambodia-military-boost/ •	2019: the reopening of the rail and sea links, bolstering diplomatic and economic ties: https://asia.nikkei.com/Economy/Thailand-and-Cambodia-reopen-rail-and-sea-links-as-ties-blossom o	“In October 2018, the two countries also signed an agreement to link ports to strengthen cooperation over tourism. They intend to connect Thailand's Koh Samui, a resort island in the Gulf of Thailand, with a port that Cambodia plans to begin building near the southern city of Kampot late this year or early 2020”


PSNOTES: 

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20220324
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20220324

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

MID4569

TERRMID: MID4569 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID4569 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID4569 From cr narrative, this was a dispute over construction of barracks in the disputed Preah Vihear region. Both sides deployed forces to the border of the disputed region. First day of dispute was on 5/13/2005 and last day of dispute was on 5/17/2005.

TERRLINK: MID4569 3 -- not third party linked to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4569 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES:

MARITMID: MID4569 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4569 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES:

ISLMID: MID4569 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4569 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID4569 3 -- not civil war
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4569 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARLINK: MID4569 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4569 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID: MID4569 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4569 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4569 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4569 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES:

MID4588

TERRMID: MID4588 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID4588 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID 4588 From cr narrative, Thailand and Cambodia exchanged fire over the disputed Preah Vihear temple area. Thailand deployed 1000 troops in an attempt to occupy and control the area, and they remained for an unknown amount of time. Small-arms clashes characterize this MID. Cambodia legally owns the area but Thailand claims it. First day of dispute was on 7/15/2008 and last day of dispute was on 10/29/2010.

TERRLINK: MID4588 3 -- not third party linked to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4588 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES:

MARITMID: MID4588 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4588 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES:

ISLMID: MID4588 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4588 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES:

CIVWARMID: MID4588 3 -- not civil war
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4588 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID4588 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4588 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID4588 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4588 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4588 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4588 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES:

MID1225

TERRMID: MID1225 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID1225 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1225 From cr narrative, upon the French withdrawal from Cambodia in 1953, Thai forces occupied the site of the Preah Vihear temple. Sovereignty over the temple had been disputed prior to French occupation. Cambodia challenged Thailand's claim to the temple and the surrounding land. MID1225 occurred 11/1953 through 5/1954.

TERRLINK: MID1225 3 -- not third party linked to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1225 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES:

MARITMID: MID1225 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1225 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES:

ISLMID: MID1225 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1225 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES:

CIVWARMID: MID1225 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1225 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID1225 3 -- not civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1225 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID: MID1225 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID1225 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID1225 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1225 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID1226

TERRMID: MID1226 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID1226 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1226 coded non-territorial because although Preah Vihear temple is disputed, this was not an attempt to occupy territory or use force to address dispute. From cm narrative, Thailand declared a state of emergency along the Cambodian border in response to Cambodia establishing diplomatic relations with China. Thailand feared a communist infiltration into Thailand. Cambodia refused Thailand's offer to allow visitors to the Preah Vihear temple, and then blew up bridges. Occurred 8/1958-9/1959.

TERRLINK: MID1226 3 -- not third party linked to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1226 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES:

MARITMID: MID1226 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1226 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES:

ISLMID: MID1226 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1226 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES:

CIVWARMID: MID1226 3 -- not civil war
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1226 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID1226 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1226 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID: MID1226 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID1226 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID1226 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1226 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES:

MID1227

TERRMID: MID1227 1 -- territorial MID 
TERRMID-CER: MID1227 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1227 is centered on the Preah Vihear temple. Cambodia suspected that Thailand would violate their sovereignty over the Preah Vihear temple, prompting strained relations and eventual severing of diplomatic relations. Occurred from June through December of 1961. From cr narrative.

TERRLINK: MID1227 3 -- not third party linked to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1227 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID1227 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1227 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES:

ISLMID: MID1227 3 -- not islands
ISLMID-CER: MID1227 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES:

CIVWARMID: MID1227 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1227 2 -- somewhat uncertain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID1227 preceded the Cambodian Civil War by several years, but was centered on the Preah Vihear temple, a long-standing territorial dispute that was independent of any concerns of civil war activity. CR narrative indicates that "insurgent activity [in Cambodia] fueled [Cambodia's] suspicions" that Thailand would take advantage of strained military resources in Cambodia to make an opportunistic invasion of the disputed area, but this does not constitute a MID that was driven by actual civil war events. Basically, Cambodia was wary of perceptions of its own weakness and seemed to attempt to show resolve by engaging in events that constitute MID1227. 

CIVWARLINK: MID1227 3 -- not civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1227 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID1227 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID1227 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID1227 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1227 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID1228

TERRMID: MID1228 1 -- territorial MID 
TERRMID-CER: MID1228 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1228 From cr narrative, MID1228 is centered on the Preah Vihear temple. The two parties submitted the case to the ICJ, which ruled in 1962 that Cambodia had sole sovereignty over the temple. Thailand protested this decision and erected a barbed wire fence to prevent Cambodia from reclaiming it. Thailand eventually complied, but both sides made minor incursions into the territory shortly thereafter. Occurred from June through November of 1962.

TERRLINK: MID1228 3 -- not third party linked to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1228 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID1228 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1228 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID1228 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1228 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID1228 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1228 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARLINK: MID1228 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1228 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID1228 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID1228 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID1228 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1228 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES:

MID2623

TERRMID: MID2623 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID2623 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2623 From cm narrative, MID2623 pertains to the Preah Vihear temple and occurred from July through November 1963. Thailand made minor incursions into the territory surrounding the temple, provoking minor military incidents.

MID1229

TERRMID: MID1229 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID1229 1 -- certain
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1229 From cm narrative, MID1229 involved many military clashes even though a UN special commission was deployed to help resolve the territorial dispute. The violence was again centered on the Preah Vihear temple.

MID2624

TERRMID: MID2624 3 -- not territorial 
TERRMID-CER: MID2624 1 -- certain
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2624 This MID concerns maritime boundary (see below).

TERRLINK: MID2624 3 -- not third party linked to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2624 1 -- certain
TERRLINK-NOTES:

MARITMID: MID2624 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID2624 1 -- certain
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2624 From cm narrative, occurred when a Cambodian patrol vessel crossed the maritime boundary into Thailand. Thailand fishermen had previously been captured in Cambodian waters, resulting in the deaths of 5 fishermen. Occurred between December 1964 to January 1965.

ISLMID: MID2624 3 -- not islands
ISLMID-CER: MID2624 1 -- certain
ISLMID-NOTES: Although this MID is referred to as the "Koh Kong Islands" dispute, the name comes from the proximity to the Koh Kong island which lies near the maritime boundary. MID2624 was not over the island itself. 

CIVWARMID: MID2624 3 -- not civil war
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2624 1 -- certain
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2624 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2624 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID: MID2624 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2624 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2624 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2624 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID1216

TERRMID: MID1216 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID1216 1 -- certain
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1216 From cm narrative, MID1216 is a multilateral MID involving China and Cambodia versus US, Thailand, and South Vietnam. In response to Cambodia allowing Vietnamese communist rebels to set up bases along the Vietnamese border, US, Thai, and Vietnamese forces entered Cambodian territory to pursue the rebels. Most relevant here is that, during this dispute, Thai forces attacked and occupied the Preah Vihear temple (April 1966). 

TERRLINK: MID1216 1 -- third party linked to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID1216 1 -- certain
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID1216 this MID is connected to the Vietnam War, a territorial dispute outside this dyad. The MID trigger involves Cambodia allowing Vietnamese communist rebels to set up bases along the border inside Cambodia.

MARITMID: MID1216 3 -- not maritime
MARITMID-CER: MID1216 1 -- certain
MARITMID-NOTES:

ISLMID: MID1216 3 -- not islands
ISLMID-CER: MID1216 1 -- certain
ISLMID-NOTES:

CIVWARMID: MID1216 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1216 1 -- certain
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID1216 involved Cambodia allowing Vietnamese communist rebels to set up bases along the border inside Cambodia. These rebels fought as part of the Vietnam War. 

CIVWARLINK: MID1216 1 -- civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1216 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID1216 coded civil war link because this is a multilateral civil war MID also appearing in the Cambodia-S Vietnam dyad, 811817. 

COUPMID: MID1216 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID1216 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID1216 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1216 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES:

MID1230

TERRMID: MID1230 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID1230 1 -- certain
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1230 From cm narrative, MID1230 involved military clashes over the Preah Vihear temple.

CIVWARMID-CER: MID1230 1 -- certain
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID1230 occurred during the Cambodian Civil War, but this dispute was about the long-standing territorial dispute centered on the Preah Vihear temple. Not related to the events of the civil war in Cambodia.

MID1610

TERRMID-CER: MID1610 1 -- certain
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1610 From cm narrative, military disputes centered on control of the Preah Vihear temple.

CIVWARMID-CER: MID1610 1 -- certain
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID1610 occurred during the Cambodian Civil War, but this dispute was about sovereignty over the territory on which the Preah Vihear temple sat. Was not related to civil war.

COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2938

TERRMID: MID2938 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID2938 2 -- somewhat certain
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2938 appears to be a result of the tensions regarding the Preah Vihear temple. The navies of the two countries exchanged fire on Feb 4, 1969. This seems to be a routine display/use of force that reflects the unresolved territorial dispute and signals the resolve of both parties to uphold their claim. Coded somewhat uncertain because no specific reason by either country was given for the exchange, but there is good reason to believe that this was over the territorial dispute. With the exception of MID1216 (multilateral Vietnam war MID), all previous MIDs were over the Preah Vihear temple, and many following MIDs were over the temple. There is no evidence that this clash was driven by rebel activity in Cambodia (CIVWARMIDs and TERRMIDs are the two primary types of MIDs in this dyad). 

TERRLINK: MID2938 3 -- not third party linked to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2938 1 -- certain
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2938 3 -- not maritime
MARITMID-CER: MID2938 2 -- somewhat certain
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2938 From cm narrative, Cambodian and Thai navies exchanged fire, with no deaths reported. However, no evidence could be found (Keesings, Facts on File, NYT Historical Archives) that this was dispute was over maritime boundary issues, or that one country had violated the maritime sovereignty of the other. Coded somewhat certain because no specific information could be found regarding the reason for the exchange of fire, but there is good reason to believe it was over the Preah Vihear territorial dispute and is thus most likely a TERRMID (see TERRMID-NOTES). 

ISLMID: MID2938 3 -- not islands
ISLMID-CER: MID2938 1 -- certain
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2938 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2938 2 -- somewhat certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID2938 occurred during the Cambodian Civil War, but there is no evidence that this clash was driven by rebel activities in either country. Rather, it seems to be associated with the long-running tension over the Preah Vihear temple. Coded somewhat certain because we do not have specific information about the reason for this exchange of naval fire, but it seems to be the case that it was driven by Preah Vihear, not any rebel activity. All CIVWARMIDs in this dyad involved clashes/exchanges of fire on land, not between navies. 

CIVWARLINK: MID2938 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2938 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID: MID2938 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2938 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2938 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2938 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID1605

TERRMID: MID1605 1 -- territorial MID 
TERRMID-CER: MID1605 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1605 From cm narrative, MID1605 is centered on the Preah Vihear temple. Minor military incidents were involved. 

TERRLINK: MID1605 3 -- not third party linked to territory
TERRLINK-CER: MID1605 1 -- certain
TERRLINK-NOTES:

MARITMID: MID1605 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1605 1 -- certain
MARITMID-NOTES:

ISLMID-CER: MID1605 1 -- certain
ISLMID-NOTES:

CIVWARMID: MID1605 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1605 1 -- certain
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID1605 occurred during the Cambodian Civil War, but was a result of a long territorial dispute over the Preah Vihear temple, and not connected to events of the civil war in Cambodia.

CIVWARLINK: MID1605 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1605 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:
